greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Tree of Lucky sieve: a(0) = 1, a(1) = 2; after which a(2n) = A269369(a(n)), a(2n+1) = 2*a(n).
comment: Permutation of natural numbers obtained from the Lucky sieve. Note the indexing: Domain starts from 0, range from 1.

This sequence can be represented as a binary tree. After a(1)=2, each left hand child is obtained by applying A269369 to the parent, and each right hand child is obtained by doubling the contents of the parent node, when the parent node contains n:
Sequence A269375 is obtained from the mirror image of the same tree.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..4095
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
xref: Cf. A000959 (with 2 inserted between 1 and 3 forms the left edge of the tree).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 01 2016
